Description:
Stack creating a VPC and launch EC2 instances within it.
    **WARNING** This template creates Amazon EC2 instances.
    You will be billed for the AWS resources used if you create
    a stack from this template. **WARNING** This template creates
    role for the launching/deleting instances/subnets/interfaces.
    This role will invoke AWSLambdaBasicExecutionRole, please see
    AWS Documentation for details on AWSLambdaBasicExecutionRole. For StackName please specify only Alphanumeric characters and maximum 10 characters as this CFT invoke a nested CFT.

AgentControlCIDR1.default: Control Subnet for CyPerf Agents for AZ1

AgentControlCIDR2.default: Control Subnet for CyPerf Agents for AZ2

ControllerNetworkCIDR1.default: Management Subnet for CyPerf Controller for AZ1

TagBehindApplicationLB.default: Agents Tag running Behind Application LB

AgentTestCIDR1.default: Test Subnet for CyPerf Agents for AZ1

AgentTestCIDR2.default: Test Subnet for CyPerf Agents for AZ2

ApplicationLBTargetGroup.Description: ARN of HTTP target group behind ALB

ApplicationLBTargetGroupHTTPS.Description: ARN of HTTPS target group behind ALB

ApplicationLBHTTPHealthChkPort.Description: TCP/IP port of the ApplicationLB HTTP Health Check

ApplicationLBHTTPListenerPort.Description: TCP/IP port of the ApplicationLB HTTP Listener

AvailabilityZone1.Description: Preferred Availability Zone where 1st server instance should deploy

AvailabilityZone2.Description: Preferred Availability Zone where 2nd server instance should deploy

CertificateARN.Description: Retrieves a certificate specified by ARN & associate it with Load Balancer's HTTPS listener profile. Example: arn:aws:iam::<AccountID>:server-certificate/<Server certificate name>

ApplicationLBHTTPSHealthChkPort.Description: TCP/IP port of the ApplicationLB HTTPS Health Check

ApplicationLBHTTPSListenerPort.Description: TCP/IP port of the ApplicationLB HTTPS Listener

KeyNameForCyPerfAgent.ConstraintDescription: must be the name of an existing EC2 KeyPair
KeyNameForCyPerfAgent.Description: Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the CyPerf instances

AgentControlCIDR1.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
AgentControlCIDR1.Description: CyPerf agents at AZ1 will use this subnet for control plane communication with controller

AgentControlCIDR2.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
AgentControlCIDR2.Description: CyPerf agents at AZ2 will use this subnet for control plane communication with controller

ControllerNetworkCIDR1.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
ControllerNetworkCIDR1.Description: This subnet is attached to CyPerf controller and would be used to access the CyPerf controllers' UI. Also used for Load Balancer subnet for AZ1.

ControllerNetworkCIDR2.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
ControllerNetworkCIDR2.Description: This subnet is used for Load Balancer subnet for AZ2

AllowedSubnet.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
AllowedSubnet.Description: Subnet range allowed to access deployed AWS resources

TagBehindApplicationLB.Description: CyPerf Agent Tag running behind Application LB

AgentTestCIDR1.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
AgentTestCIDR1.Description: CyPerf agents will use this subnet for test traffic at AZ1

AgentTestCIDR2.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.
AgentTestCIDR2.Description: CyPerf agents will use this subnet for test traffic at AZ2

Username.Description: Team or Individual email id responsible for the Stack

VPCCIDR.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.

ScaleCapacityMax.Description: Number of maximum CyPerf Server Agent to run

ScaleCapacityMin.Description: Number of minimum CyPerf Server Agent to run

NetworkOutBytesPerMinute.Description: Average network out capacity to trigger auto scaling
